intro: Pyrrocoma lanceolata var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf pyrrocoma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, such as forest understories. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
